page.title: 11FULFORTH FARM P2
page.content: Later it is used as a grain store until the grain is sold.There are still several old buildings,used for storing implements and keeping a few chickens etc. ,and some machinery stands outside. The farm house itself is 17th century -a fine building on a lovely site.It has not been altered structurally.The house is built of sandstone with walls 2\ feet thick. The farm is roughly half arable, half grassland - some fields are permanent pasture especially a few near the valley which have very steep slopes.The rotation is less strictly followed than it used to be ,as heavy and expensive dressings of artificial fertilizers can maintain crop yields. The main crops are grain (barley is most important -but also some wheat and oats),ley(rotational grass for hay and silage),turnips.
